addProfile(int,int,java.lang.String,int).name: addProfile(int,int,java.lang.String,int)
addProfile(int,int,java.lang.String,int).documentation: Add a profile to be returned by {@link #getProfiles(int)}.

addUser(int,java.lang.String,int).name: addUser(int,java.lang.String,int)

addUserProfile(android.os.UserHandle).name: addUserProfile(android.os.UserHandle)

canSwitchUsers().name: canSwitchUsers()
canSwitchUsers().documentation: Returns {@code true} by default, or the value specified via {@link #setCanSwitchUser(boolean)}.

clearUserRestrictions(android.os.UserHan.name: clearUserRestrictions(android.os.UserHandle)
clearUserRestrictions(android.os.UserHan.documentation: Removes all user restrictions set of a user identified by {@code userHandle}.

getApplicationRestrictions(java.lang.Str.name: getApplicationRestrictions(java.lang.String)

getProfiles(int).name: getProfiles(int)
getProfiles(int).documentation:
If any profiles have been added using {@link #addProfile}, return those profiles.

Otherwise follow real android behaviour.

isDemoUser().name: isDemoUser()
isDemoUser().documentation: @return `false` by default, or the value specified via {@link #setIsDemoUser(boolean)}

isLinkedUser().name: isLinkedUser()
isLinkedUser().documentation: @return 'false' by default, or the value specified via {@link #setIsLinkedUser(boolean)}

isManagedProfile().name: isManagedProfile()

isSystemUser().name: isSystemUser()
isSystemUser().documentation: @return 'true' by default, or the value specified via {@link #setIsSystemUser(boolean)}

setCanSwitchUser(boolean).name: setCanSwitchUser(boolean)
setCanSwitchUser(boolean).documentation:
Sets whether switching users is allowed or not; controls the return value of {@link
UserManager#canSwitchUser()}

setIsDemoUser(boolean).name: setIsDemoUser(boolean)
setIsDemoUser(boolean).documentation:
Sets that the current user is a demo user; controls the return value of {@link
UserManager#isDemoUser()}.

@deprecated Use {@link ShadowUserManager#addUser(int, String, int)} to create a demo user
    instead of changing default user flags.

setIsGuestUser(boolean).name: setIsGuestUser(boolean)
setIsGuestUser(boolean).documentation:
Sets that the current user is the guest user; controls the return value of {@link
UserManager#isGuestUser()}.

@deprecated Use {@link ShadowUserManager#addUser(int, String, int)} to create a guest user
    instead of changing default user flags.

setIsLinkedUser(boolean).name: setIsLinkedUser(boolean)
setIsLinkedUser(boolean).documentation:
Sets that the current user is the linked user; controls the return value of {@link
UserManager#isLinkedUser()}.

@deprecated Use {@link ShadowUserManager#addUser(int, String, int)} to create a linked user
    instead of changing default user flags.

setIsPrimaryUser(boolean).name: setIsPrimaryUser(boolean)
setIsPrimaryUser(boolean).documentation:
Sets that the current user is the primary user; controls the return value of {@link
UserManager#isPrimaryUser()}.

@deprecated Use {@link ShadowUserManager#addUser(int, String, int)} to create a primary user
    instead of changing default user flags.

setIsSystemUser(boolean).name: setIsSystemUser(boolean)
setIsSystemUser(boolean).documentation:
Sets that the current user is the system user; controls the return value of {@link
UserManager#isSystemUser()}.

@deprecated Use {@link ShadowUserManager#addUser(int, String, int)} to create a system user
    instead of changing default user flags.

setSerialNumberForUser(android.os.UserHa.name: setSerialNumberForUser(android.os.UserHandle,long)
setSerialNumberForUser(android.os.UserHa.documentation:
@deprecated prefer {@link #addUserProfile(UserHandle)} to ensure consistency of profiles known
to the {@link UserManager}. Furthermore, calling this method for the current user, i.e: {@link
Process#myUserHandle()} is no longer necessary as this user is always known to UserManager and
has a preassigned serial number.

setUserState(android.os.UserHandle,org.r.name: setUserState(android.os.UserHandle,org.robolectric.shadows.ShadowUserManager.UserState)
setUserState(android.os.UserHandle,org.r.documentation:
Sets the current state for a given user, see {@link UserManager#isUserRunning(UserHandle)}
and {@link UserManager#isUserRunningOrStopping(UserHandle)}

switchUser(int).name: switchUser(int)
switchUser(int).documentation:
Switches the current user to {@code userHandle}.

@param userId the integer handle of the user, where 0 is the primary user.
